content.description:
Area Classic! Sit start on low holds underneath the prominent prow with feet on the right wall. Work right and up around the prow pressing against the back wall. Figure out the super funky beta to gain the top of the prow and the left hand rail. Work left until you can get a jam in the creepy but solid flake above the prow and mantle it out.

 Avoid back stepping on the slab to the left of the problem.
content.protection: Pad Party + Spotters. This area needs at least 3, preferably more pads for a decent landing.

content.description: Start as for "Under The Bull" but then work left onto the slab and figure out the weird balancy moves that let you make it up between the two wall like features.
content.protection: Pad Party + Spotters. These problems need at least 3 pads to be reasonably well protected.

content.description:
Stand start to the right of "Under the bull". Wedge yourself into the dihedral and work your way up pulling on chock-stones (they seemed solid on FA day) and leveraging against both walls. Top out on easier terrain.

 Both of the chock stones seemed lodged solidly in place.
content.protection: Pads + don't fall. - this one is hard to pad up, especially with the trajectory you would take if you biffed it.

content.description:
Easy easy highball. Good intro climb. 

 A few bold project routes are downhill to the right.
content.location: One slot closer to the parking lot than Under The Bull. There is an old, rusted flag pole on top of the prow.

content.description: This is a series of small ridges downhill and left of "The Slant". Problems range from v-easy to around v6. Expect bad landings and the need for multiple pads and a few spotters. Good climbing on the problems that are cleaned up makes the area worth the scramble down to them.
